website_summaries.verdict: This is a solid performer that is a joy to use but is more expensive than similar products.
pros: Fantastic battery life and very intuitive interface
cons: Expensive and 50-foot range is a bit disappointing for the price

customer_reviews.title: Best clicker out there
customer_reviews.text: I've used a version of this remote for about 20 years. This latest works just as great as I knew it would. I speak and coach and my students and clients often use it as well. It gets a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi Maxey

customer_reviews.title: Have used this remote for over 10 years and it is still the best
customer_reviews.text: This PC remote is only for giving PowerPoint presentations. This is what makes it great. not a wireless mouse or anything else. If you want to control PowerPoint only this is the one to get. Only four buttons; advance slide, back up to previous slide, blank screen, and laser pointer. Have used it with many different windows PCs over the years and it works right out of the box without any drivers required. Just plus the USB dongle (looks like a thumb drive) into a USB port and windows installs the device in a few seconds. Add batteries (included) and you are good to go. There are NO negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Dimi

customer_reviews.title: Bought mine in 2009;  it's now 2013 and this is still the best!
customer_reviews.text: For years, I used this model worldwide for many presentations. It has always worked with any PC that has a USB port. When I started my own consultancy, I bought my own clicker, August 2009, and use it many times each week. It travels where I travel, and in October 2013 it still works great! I've often recommended this specific model to people who need a reliable, easy to use "clicker". It rarely needs replacement batteries, but I always carry spare batteries in case some locale doesn't have spares available on-site.
customer_reviews.author: Hersbruck

customer_reviews.title: Point and Shoot!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for a couple of years now. Both my wife and I give lectures and have to flip a coin on who gets to use it when we both have presentations at the same time. this product feels great in my hand and has four basic functions, forward, backward, laser, and blackout. I don't know why you would want any other presentation remote.
customer_reviews.author: wpd3004

customer_reviews.title: Great clicker. It's very easy to use (just plug ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this remote for work presentations. Great clicker. It's very easy to use (just plug in the USB drive into your computer and open up PowerPoint and you can go through slides, etc). The laser is quite strong and it just looks very professional. This is the third one we've ordered for our office and every other user is attached to it for all presentations.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Nice, basic
customer_reviews.text: Nice, basic, easy to use. Advances slides and has a laser pointer built in. Only downside (and this would happen with any laser pointer) - so many businesses are using TV type screens for presentations (vs. old projector screens) - and laser pointers don't show up on the screen)
customer_reviews.author: Harleyjan99

customer_reviews.title: Quality and no-fuss reliability
customer_reviews.text: This thing is solid, does its job well, and makes absolutely no hassles. I haven't been surprised or had a slide miscue on me since I bought this. It works all the way across a classroom and feels solid in-hand, so you can concentrate on the presentation. Sometimes it's worth it to pay for quality.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Haensel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, no software install required, metal, reliable, desirable!
customer_reviews.text: We use this "clicker" for administrators who are not tech savvy, or visitors who will be presenting who may not have time to get familiarized with the "clicker" before walking up to give the presentation. This unit requires no software to be installed and is drop dead simple. It also has a laser pointer. The batteries last a long time and the unit is metal with rubber on the bottom and feels and fits in the hand very well. Highly recommended for simplicity, usability, durability and desirability to "high ups" who have their local people order one for them to use at their home location!
customer_reviews.author: THATCHMAN1

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best
customer_reviews.text: I have used a number of these wireless navigators and this one is simply the best. I just bought a second one for my own personal use, when I am giving talks away from work. It is beautifully constructed, easy to operate (plug and play--anyone can do it, no troubles), well-designed and SIMPLE. It uses AAA batteries (no funky watch-type batteries, thank you!) and has performed great. The laser pointer is bright enough for me and we look at bright LCD projections in well-lit rooms. Overall, this is as close to perfect as it gets.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lio

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after intermittent use over last two years. New batteries did not fix.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great clicker!
customer_reviews.text: I have used a number of presentation clickers over the years and this is my favorite. Costs a little more but it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: lbrown23

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a new one after the previous one gave up after about 8 years of constant powerpt. presentations. Wonderfully made and excellent for wireless powerpt presentation and the red laser is strong, you can see it pointing from a distance.
customer_reviews.author: June C. Mcbride

customer_reviews.title: Favorite presentation remote!
customer_reviews.text: Own several of these and easily my favorite presentation remote. Works flawlessly, super range, positive feedback one each click. Red laser version is a bit underwhelming for a large conference, but the green laser is great!
customer_reviews.author: Troy Chollar

customer_reviews.title: Best navigator for the price
customer_reviews.text: Best navigator for the price. Easy to use and the distance is much further than the older models; laser pointer also very easy to use while holding the device
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective design.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and works great. The last thing you want to hand a presenter is a complicated controller. This design has just the basics and a bright laser pointer to boot.
customer_reviews.author: V0X

customer_reviews.title: No Drivers Required and MEGA EASY to operate!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is my favorite because the professors that use it can't "screw it up" :) It's back button actually takes you back in the powerpoint instead of being a right mouse click like some advancers use. Also it requires no cd or anything to install before the unit will work. And it works at very long range. I love this unit and highly recommend it. Interlink's upgrade to this has a joystick that works like a mouse, but it doesn't work well and complicates the issue for the users. So this is the one I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Price

customer_reviews.title: Our management team love these clickers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these remote controls for a member of our management team to use with his PowerPoint Presentations back in 2006. Three others who saw it had me order one for each of them.
customer_reviews.author: flibbertigibbet

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professor at a local college and I needed one to help with presentations. This little gadget is fantastic and it has never failed me. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Works great. 1st time I used it was on someone else's PC. I had to cover for another person and I just plugged in the USB key, and started flipping through slides from across the room. All the keys worked great.
customer_reviews.author: R. Paton

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased this remote
customer_reviews.text: This remote is the best in the business. I did not give it 5-stars because the user has to remove the batteries when not in use. Wish it had an on-off switch.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Calahan

customer_reviews.title: Purchased in October 2016 & it's already not working. ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in October 2016 & it's already not working. I can't return it either. Amazon should make it easier to return items past 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: SHovious

customer_reviews.title: Good presentation pointer!!!
customer_reviews.text: We use these at work and I had to have one for myself that was mine so I didn't have to share....
customer_reviews.author: Rodney A. May

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I used it in one meeting so far, but I had seen someone else use the same one. It's an excellent all-around presentation tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: With a simple design, it's very easy to explain for multiple users. Besides using it close to the computer, we've used it several times at a range of 50-75 feet with a clear line of sight and it works perfectly. If you want a good remote, it's worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: mdcmc

customer_reviews.title: Comes recommend for durability and long lasting by my colleagues
customer_reviews.text: Solid and quality. Comes recommend for durability and long lasting by my colleagues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Remote point
customer_reviews.text: Great products, it fits perfectly in your hand and it gives you something to hold done to that is not going to drop out of your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Joselito

customer_reviews.title: Best/Simplest Presentation Device yet
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for professional/college classroom presentations for over 6 years. Does exactly what you need without hassle of any programming. Would recommend to all professional speakers and teaching professions.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: So far, I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this remote pointer for a self-titled technology-impaired person in my office who hasn't had it long enough to rate battery life, longevity, etc., but this person raves about its ease of use compared to the previous product he'd been using.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION: DOES NOT WORK WITH WINDOWS 8.1
customer_reviews.text: I have a colleague who uses this and it has been great. However, when I received mine it would not work. After talking with company support I learned that it is not working with Windows 8.1. My BIOS did not present the solution they offered. I am returning it and waiting till the company and Microsoft get this sorted out. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: P. Thorsen

customer_reviews.title: Right Solution
customer_reviews.text: The remote fits snugly in the hand. It is compact and therefore not obstrusive. The operation is simple. It gets the job done. It just the product for which I was looking.
customer_reviews.author: amzcuz

customer_reviews.title: i like it
customer_reviews.text: i like it, very good navigator. it can be operated successfully which is separated by two doors. i used it only for one weeks, i do not know how about the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: The product is excellent and the person who sold it to me packaged it well and got it to me in a timely manor.
customer_reviews.author: Misti Burmeister

customer_reviews.title: RemotePoint Navigator 2.4
customer_reviews.text: The product is excellent. In my estimation the best on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Waggoner

customer_reviews.title: Review of PowerPoint Remote
customer_reviews.text: The description needed to say the distance it is capable of sending to. I was disappointed that it won't reach the front of the church from the back of the church to control PowerPoint presentations.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine M. Squires

customer_reviews.title: Simple and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for a presentation the other day after not using it for a long time. The original batteries still worked! After sitting for years! Pros: Simple user controls, easy set-up, RF communication which often is better than line-of-sight IR, laser pointer, fairly compact and easy to store, screen blank- un-blank button. Generally less expensive than devices with more features. Cons: No built-in memory for your presentation in the USB part, no mouse control in this version limits what you can use it for, you have to remove the batteries to prevent it turning on and draining the energy from them.
customer_reviews.author: EMTP EJ

customer_reviews.title: The best, period
customer_reviews.text: I present for a living, I have used this remote for over four years for hundreds of presentations. It has never let me down. Anyone who says they have to push the buttons more than once simply does not have their PowerPoint set up right! The case is sturdy, feels great and is flawless in use. I have tried more expensive and they are simply not worth it. This is simple to use, works on any computer and if you need more than forward, back, blank screen and laser you are making it way too complicated!
customer_reviews.author: James E. Dion

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless remote
customer_reviews.text: This remote is the best I have tried. It is simple (only four functions) and does exactly what I want. The reception is great, and the buttons are responsive. I have had mine for five years and have not had a problem with it. The size is perfect, and it is comfortable to hold. I have tried numerous other remotes from Interlink and other manufacturers, and none felt as solid, comfortable, and dependable as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Nemanick

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I used this remote for the first time last week for a presentation and am here looking into buying one. The control, feel, and buttons are great. It feels good in your hand and appears to be reliable. My only concern is the size of the laser "point" onscreen. It is a bit small. Not bad, but a minor concern. I had no problems with hitting the "black" button to end the show or to make a point during my presentation. Overall, a solid model.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Simply THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: As a professional speaker, I have used them all. The client hands me a remote and maybe it works and maybe it doesn't. Short range? Line-of-sight? Give me a break. This one works anywhere in the room every time. I carry my own and use it unless the client insists theirs is better (but it never is). Mine is 6 years old now and works perfectly, after 1-5 presentations per week.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Landis

customer_reviews.title: Laser dies quickly just like the VP4300
customer_reviews.text: This was the second atempt to try the Interlink Remote after disappointed with the VP4300. It had almost the identical problem as the VP4300 except the buttons are a little firmer. The control of PowerPoint is excellet except again the blank screen button is often accidentally pressed during the presentation. My biggest problem is the laser. It is way too weak and dies often in the middle of a presentation.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of the Interlink VP4150 RemotePoint Navigator 2.4's for our department. Faculty love using this. It was a great price and easy to use. I have had one of the faculty purchase one on her own after using the departments. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was recommended by our IT department and no one has had a problem with it as of yet. It was easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: L. T.

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our department in a large company after a recommendation from another department. The word is spreading about this little gizmo - everyone who uses it loves it. It's simple & gets the job done without hiccups or problems. There are no problems with reliability, either. The folks in our organization who have used it recommend it without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hillman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good, but sometimes you have to click twice. Better than most.

customer_reviews.title: It works on Linux too!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried that it might not work on Linux (SLED 10), but it does! Love it!

customer_reviews.title: Good price, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This presentation remote is very easy to use and has all the basics you need to enhance any presentation. Plug-n-play set up.
